perturbation.original_text: MAINTENANCE OF SOLVENCY. This provision applies only to benefits provided through the General Account. If the solvency of the Society becomes impaired, you may be required to make an extra payment. The Board of Directors will determine the amount of any extra payment. It will be based on each member's fair share of the deficiency. You may make the extra payment by an equivalent reduction in benefits or by a payment in cash. If you do not make the extra payment within 60 days from the date we notify you of your share of the deficiency, the amount will be charged as an indebtedness against the contract with interest compounded at the rate of 5% per year.
perturbation.changed_text: MAINTENANCE OF SOLVENCY. This provision applies only to benefits provided through the General Account. If the solvency of Thrivent Financial for Lutherans becomes impaired, you may be required to provide additional funds. The Executive Committee will determine the amount of any required contribution. It will be based on a calculation they deem appropriate. You may satisfy this obligation through an equivalent reduction in benefits, a payment in cash, or any method deemed acceptable by the Society. If you do not satisfy this obligation within 30 days from the date we notify you, the amount will be considered a loan against the contract with interest calculated at the prevailing market rate.
perturbation.explanation: The terms 'Society' is replaced with 'Thrivent Financial for Lutherans,' 'extra payment' is replaced with 'additional funds' and 'required contribution,' 'Board of Directors' is replaced with 'Executive Committee,' 'member's fair share of the deficiency' is replaced with 'a calculation they deem appropriate', the payment period is reduced from 60 to 30 days, 'indebtedness' is replaced with 'loan', and the interest rate is changed from a fixed 5% to the 'prevailing market rate.' These changes introduce uncertainty about the calculation method, responsible party, and acceptable forms of payment, creating an internal contradiction and making the enforcement unclear.

perturbation.original_text: MEMBERSHIP. The person(s) named as the Insured(s) or the Annuitant(s) is a benefit member of the Society. Rights and privileges of membership are set forth in the Articles of Incorporation and Bylaws of the Society. These rights and privileges are separate from the ownership of this contract.
perturbation.changed_text: MEMBERSHIP. The person(s) named as the Insured(s) or the Annuitant(s) is considered a valued client of Thrivent Financial for Lutherans. Rights and privileges of client status are outlined in the Client Handbook and internal policies of Thrivent Financial for Lutherans. These rights and privileges are connected to the ownership of this contract.
perturbation.explanation: The terms 'benefit member of the Society' is replaced with 'valued client of Thrivent Financial for Lutherans', 'Articles of Incorporation and Bylaws of the Society' is replaced with 'Client Handbook and internal policies of Thrivent Financial for Lutherans' and 'separate from the ownership of this contract' is replaced with 'connected to the ownership of this contract.' The original text references formal governing documents, whereas the modified version refers to internal policies. The conflicting statements regarding whether membership/client status is tied to contract ownership creates ambiguity and internal contradiction.

perturbation.original_text: DIVIDENDS. Each year, we will determine our divisible surplus. This contract's share, if any, will be credited as a dividend. Since we do not expect this contract to contribute to divisible surplus, it is not expected that any dividends will be credited.
perturbation.changed_text: REWARDS. Each year, the company may, at its discretion, allocate a portion of its profits. This contract's share, if any, will be distributed as a reward. Considering current economic conditions and company performance, the provision of any rewards is not guaranteed and is subject to change.
perturbation.explanation: The terms 'dividends' is replaced with 'rewards', 'divisible surplus' is replaced with 'portion of its profits', and 'credited' is replaced with 'distributed.' Also introducing a condition to economic conditions and company performance. While the original text discusses dividends based on a divisible surplus, the modified text introduces the concept of 'rewards' based on company profits and subject to company discretion. This contradicts the original expectation that no dividends would be credited by stating that rewards are possible but not guaranteed and depend on factors outside the contract's provisions, thereby creating an internal contradiction regarding potential financial benefits.
